definition: a person whose residence and place of business are at a distance
examples: His house was a place of refuge for outliers.

definition: something (such as a geologic feature) that is situated away from or classed differently from a main or related body
examples: The island is an outlier on the southeast side of the archipelago.

definition: a statistical observation that is markedly different in value from the others of the sample
examples: Values that are outliers give disproportionate weight to larger over smaller values.

definition: a person or thing that is atypical within a particular group, class, or category
examples: She was an outlier when she launched her cruelty-free, sustainably minded brand in 2001, but has found the centre of gravity shifting in her direction.

Among the world's wealthy nations, the United States is an outlier on this issue: Americans have the lowest national minimum wage, relative to the median wage, of any of the wealthy nations represented in the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.
